title: Business Live: US shares rise - BBC News
summary: sports direct strikes esports deal with game digital .

documents.title: good night
text: thank you for joining us on business live .
we 'll be back on tuesday morning at 6.00am sharp when the big news will be the latest inflation figures for january .
see you then .

documents.title: the male jumpsuit - coming to an office near you ?
text: are casual fridays still a thing ?
business live hopes so because has fashion got a treat in store for the sartorial gent - the jumpsuit !
that 's right , apparently the male jumpsuit is having a moment and a brave chap from the wall street journal wore one to see what all the fuss is about .
paul newman donned one in his heyday so they must be cool - although that was back in the 1970s .
will we see the jumpsuit in the city of london or perhaps on wall street ?
one can only hope

documents.title: monday market winners
text: the announcement of president trump 's infrastructure spending plan helped materials and industrials .
top winners on the dow on monday were american express ( up 3.55 % after an analyst upgrade ) , boeing ( up 3.49 % ) and dow dupont ( up 3.37 % ) .

documents.title: us stock markets close
text: the dow jones industrial average rebounded by 410 points on monday to close at 24,601.27 .
that was a rise of 1.7 % .
the broader-based s & p 500 gained 1.4 % to end the day at 2,655.73 .
the tech-rich nasdaq advanced 1.5 % to 6,976.65 .

documents.title: may urges 'one final push ' on stormont deal
text: may urges 'one final push ' on stormont deal

documents.title: end of story ?
text: on sunday it looked like the credits were set to roll on discussions between the troubled weinstein company and prospective investors , led by businesswoman maria contreras-sweet .
new york 's attorney general filed a lawsuit against the studio , alleging it failed to protect employees from sexual misconduct , making the whole deal a lot less attractive .
variety reported that talks had stalled as a result .
now though , the news agency afp says they could still be on .
they quote an anonymous source admitting that the discussions are however `` very fluid '' .
so we 'll have to wait and see .

documents.title: where next for us stock markets ?
text: is monday 's rise in us stocks the end of steep falls witnessed last week ?
not so fast , says mark luschini , chief investment strategist at janney montgomery scott .
`` it 's too soon to tell if it 's a counter trend rally that 's sustainable , '' he says .

while jeff schulze , investment strategist at clearbridge investments , says : `` i do believe we have n't seen the low , we 're pretty close to it and that this is a buying opportunity , just longer term in nature . ''

documents.title: tata to invest in port talbot repair
text: tata 'to invest £ 75m in port talbot blast furnace repair '
@ twitterid excellent

documents.title: trump 's infrastructure blueprint 'a scam '
text: trump 's infrastructure blueprint 'a scam '

documents.title: ww2 bomb near city airport moved
text: the metropolitan police said that a 500kg second world war bomb which has disrupted dozens of flights at london city airport has been moved .
it said that the device has been taken to a secondary location within the king george v dock .
residents displaced by the initial operation can now return home .
however , robert sinclair , chief executive of london city airport said that the airport would remain closed for the rest of the day .
lieutenant commander jonny campbell who is in charge of the diving unit which is disposing of the device , told pa what would happen next .

`` we intend to attach a flotation device to the bomb which will then gently raise it clear of the seabed , but it will still be covered by water which will act like a blanket to absorb the effect of any explosion .
it will always remain under water .
`` we will tow it down the thames out into the estuary and we 'll take it to a site where we will conduct a controlled explosion and neutralise the threat . ''

documents.title: broad-based rise in us stocks
text: the s & p 500 is also powering ahead and is now up 49.08 points at 2,668.63 .
the nasdaq has added 137.07 points to 7,010.14 .

documents.title: remington reaches bankruptcy deal with creditors
text: remington outdoor company , the us gun-maker , has reached a deal with its creditors to file for chapter 11 bankruptcy protection to deal with its $ 950m debt pile .
the company said it will receive $ 145m in financing to fund the business through the chapter 11 process .
remington is hoping to write off around $ 700m in debt .

its chief executive anthony acitelli says : `` we have an outstanding collection of brands and products , the unqualified support of a vibrant community across the industry , and a deep and powerful culture .
`` we will emerge from this process with a deleveraged balance sheet and ample liquidity , positioning remington to compete more aggressively and to seize future growth opportunities . ''

documents.title: hammond joins brexit roadshow
text: hammond joins brexit roadshow
author: Kamal Ahmed
Economics editor

documents.title: equifax under pressure after hack attack
text: equifax is facing a fresh demand to disclose the full extent of last year 's data breach , following a report that it was bigger than previously disclosed .
the wall street journal ( wsj ) reported that cyber-thieves had accessed us citizens ' email addresses , tax id numbers and more driver licence information than acknowledged earlier .
us senator elizabeth warren is now demanding details of any other data the firm believes may have been stolen .
read the full story here .

documents.title: us stocks near 500 point rise
text: it looks like the dow jones industrial average has cemented monday 's rise and is now up 489.25 points at 24,680.15 .
that 's a rise of 2 % .

documents.title: oil prices trim gains
text: on wednesday , the international energy agency will publish its monthly oil market report .
oil prices have been positive on monday helped by a weaker dollar though gains have been trimmed in afternoon trade .
brent crude is up 0.5 % at $ 63.10 and west texas intermediate is ahead 0.9 % at $ 59.73 .

fiona cincotta , senior market analyst at city index , says : `` oil had been hit by concerns over increasing us oil production , a stronger dollar last week and general risk aversion in the market as equities sold off .
`` however , whilst the dollar has eased back and oil has rallied today , there are still a number of factors working against oil which could still weigh on the price going forward . ''

documents.title: infrastructure plan boosts stocks
text: donald trump 's infrastructure announcement appears to be giving stock markets a boost .

reflecting on last week 's gyrations , ken polcari , director of the nyse floor division at o'neil securities , says : `` i think the market was way , way oversold , way too fast and therefore there 's this natural bounce . ''
but he adds : `` there 's news coming out about the budget , fiscal stimulus and infrastructure plan that is adding fuel to the fire .
people are very positive about it . ''

documents.title: investors send us shares higher
text: us stocks continue to head upwards .
after last week 's roller coaster ride , the direction is all one way on monday with the dow jones industrial average up 377.54 points , or 1.56 % at 24,568.44 .
the s & p 500 is ahead 1.31 % or 34.26 points at 2,653.81 .
the nasdaq has added 93.52 points to 6,968.01 .

documents.title: facebook broke german privacy laws , says court
text: facebook broke german privacy laws , court rules

documents.title: bp 'committed ' to post-brexit britain
text: you do n't get more british than british petroleum , according to the oil giant 's chief executive bob dudley .
mr dudley has been attending the egypt petroleum show where he was asked by cnbc if bp 's head office will remain in the uk regardless of how brexit talks conclude .
`` no , no , we 're deeply committed , i mean it 's a great british company , it 's been around for a century

`` it 's not for me to speak for britain by the way , on the negotiations , so nobody should misunderstand that , but for bp , ( we 're ) deeply committed to britain , we will be around for a long , long time . ''

documents.title: amazon to cut jobs
text: the seattle times is reporting that ecommerce giant amazon is cutting hundreds of jobs both at its headquarters and globally .
the newspaper says that the cuts will fall primarily its consumer retail business .
a spokesman said : as part of our annual planning process , we are making head count adjustments across the company
`` for affected employees , we work to find roles in the areas where we are hiring . ''

documents.title: queuing ? there 's an app for that
text: do you hate # queuing for your turn ?
@ imogenkw has been telling @ twitterid how her app is helping cut wait times in shops , museums and other businesses # waiting # tech # innovation # apps

documents.title: london markets close higher
text: the ftse 100 has closed in positive territory , adding 84.63 points or 1.1 % to 7,177.06 .
steel producer evraz led the risers , up 5.7 % at 352.3p .
conversely , severn trent was the biggest faller with its share price down 1.9 % at £ 17.86 .
the ftse 250 ended up 161.84 points at 19,379.33 .

documents.title: burgers pay dividends for restaurant brands
text: burger aficionados continue to love their whoppers .
restaurant brands international , the owner of burger king , has announced that like-for-like sales at the chain rose by 4.6 % in the fourth quarter to 31 december and by 3.1 % over the full year .
it was the best performing business within restaurant brands international .
total revenue across the group , which also owns coffee and donut chain tim horton and fried chicken fast food business popeyes , rose to $ 1.2bn from $ 1.1bn for the final quarter .
for the year , overall sales grew to $ 4.5 from $ 4.1bn .
net income grew strongly in the three months to december and for the year .

documents.title: trump sets out infrastructure hopes
text: us president donald trump has set out his $ 200bn infrastructure plan through which he hopes to update us roads , bridges and airports .
or , in other words
this will be a big week for infrastructure .
after so stupidly spending $ 7 trillion in the middle east , it is now time to start investing in our country !
america first !
end the fabrication , end the lies , end the fake news !
# maga
president donald j trump has supported the military , the police , and the people since day 1 !
# maga # americafirst
speaking of the military how come the left can march for everything except for the military ?
let 's have a military parade ! !
# maga
police used to stop & redirect traffic and protect the marches are privately paid ?
the police are paid by the organizers of the march not funded by the federal or local governments
oh .
so they get cut a separate check and the police get to decide if they work a protest or parade or not ?
or is it more like hey there 's something your job requires you to do regardless of if you agree with it or not ?
how about using that money from the wall to actually build useful things in this country ?
good plan mr. president .
let 's invest in this country , not in a wall to make this country look weaker !
we need high speed interest everywhere .
we need high speed railways similar to what they have in the rest of the developed world .
let 's actually do something smart .
let 's build things that help america thrive , not that help america look more bigoted !
you are mad about spending $ 7 trillion in the middle east , yet you do nothing to show that you believe that over spending on the military is unneeded .
we need to invest in solar power !
that 's the future of energy not dirty coal !
solar requires investment and physical overhead .
coal has none of those burdens ''
come on guys .
let 's assume he 's correct , and he is n't , but make believe .
i ask @ twitterid simply , does it matter .
innovation always has a startup cost .
fossil is finite and pollutes , solar has 5 billion years left , 0 pollution .
is n't a healthy future worth it for the kids ?
or .

documents.title: another farrago for wells fargo
text: life is tough for wells fargo .

the us bank became infamous when it was discovered that sales staff set up millions of fake bank and credit card accounts to hit targets - causing distress to customers innocently caught up in the scandal .
at the beginning of february , the us federal reserve punished the bank by imposing a limit on how much it can grow its assets `` until it sufficiently improves its governance and controls '' .
what else could possibly go wrong ?
in an effort to make amends to people who were forced to buy motor insurance they did n't need , wells fargo sent out letters .
unfortunately , 38,000 customers received a letter they did n't need and that contained no refund .
brilliant .

documents.title: afternoon of frights ?
text: a quick check in on the us markets
the dow jones industrial average is now trading up 163.49 points at 24,354.39 .
the s & p 500 is ahead 11.73 points at 2,632.74 and the technology-heavy nasdaq is up 48.73 points at 6,926.71 .
connor campbell , financial analyst at spreadex says : the dow displayed a broadly positive , if jittery , vibe after the bell .

but he adds : `` there is still a while to go in terms of the us session , however , and the dow jones has shown a predilection for saving its wilder behaviour for later in the day , so it 's really far too early to speak with any confidence about the index 's performance . ''

documents.title: xerox investors push back against fuji deal
text: carl icahn ( and darwin deason , both major shareholders in xerox , are not happy about the us print technology giant 's plan to sell itself to fujifilm of japan .
the two men , who between them own a 15 % stake in xerox , said in an open letter : `` we urge you - our fellow shareholders - do not let fuji steal this company from us . ''
they claim that the transaction `` has a tortured , convoluted structure '' , `` dramatically undervalues xerox '' and `` disproportionately favors fuji '' .
the letter really is worth a read .

documents.title: lloyds sets non-white target for 2020
text: lloyds banking group has set a formal target for the number of non-white people it wants to employ in senior roles .
sky news reports that the ftse 100 bank wants 8 % of its top 7,000 staff to be identified as black , asian or minority ethnic ( bame ) by 2020 .
sky says that the move is part of the bank 's 2018 helping britain prosper plan which will be outlined when it publishes its full-year results later in february .

documents.title: share and share alike
text: i 'll be talking about how shared parental leave has worked for @ twitterid listen in to our chat with a bit of toddler mumbling thrown in on # worldbusinessreport @ twitterid at 1530gmt
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: bitcoin gobbling iceland energy supplies
text: iceland is facing an `` exponential '' rise in bitcoin mining that is gobbling up power resources , a spokesman for icelandic energy firm hs orka has said .
this year , electricity use at bitcoin mining data centres is likely to exceed that of all iceland 's homes , according to johann snorri sigurbergsson .
he said many potential customers were keen to get in on the act .
`` if all these projects are realised , we wo n't have enough energy for it , '' he told the bbc .
read more here .

documents.title: brace for inflation
text: there are far fewer us company results being released over the next few days compared to recent weeks but the major announcements to watch out for concern inflation .
on wednesday , the us labor department will publish its latest consumer price index figures followed by the producer price index on thursday .
if they both come in higher than expected , it could spell more interest rate rises by the us federal reserve and yet more stock market volatility .

documents.title: breakingus markets open up
text: the dow jones industrial average has opened ahead 146.86 points at 24,337.76 .
s & p 500 rose 38.55 points to 2,619.55 .
the nasdaq added 63.71 points to 6,938.20 .

documents.title: taking a stand
text: unilever threatens to pull ads from facebook and google

documents.title: blast from the past
text: remember pierre danon ?

he used to be the chief executive of bt retail , the consumer arm and was refreshingly straight-talking - none more so than when he quit the uk telecoms giant in 2004 for the consultancy and outsourcing group capgemini .
`` capgemini is giving me 100 % control of the operation , where at bt retail i only ever had one third of the operation .
i like to be in charge , '' he said at the time .

anyway , mr danon is now chairman of danish telecoms group tdc where he is urging shareholders to back a $ 6.7bn offer for the business by australian investor macquarie and three danish pension funds .
it means that tdc 's $ 2.5bn takeover of swedish mtg 's broadcasting and entertainment business will be called off .
it could be a straightforward deal or perhaps we 'll see the candid mr danon of old giving a sound bite or two .

documents.title: gold and oil prices rise
text: gold prices ticked higher on monday as the dollar fell .
the precious metal rose by 0.4 % to $ 1,316.05 an ounce .
the greenback is marginally down on the pound at $ 1.38150 .
oil price are also ahead .
brent crude rose by 1.6 % to $ 63.80 a barrel while west texas intermediate gained 1.9 % to $ 60.31 .

documents.title: inflation to hit 2.9 % ?
text: inflation is expected to have eased at the start of the year , giving consumers a further reprieve from the brexit-induced jump in the cost of living .

a consensus of economists are expecting the office for national statistics ' january consumer price index to come in at 2.9 % tomorrow , down from 3 % in december and easing further from the most recent peak of 3.1 % in november .
the bank of england says it expects inflation to drop back towards its 2 % target in the coming months .

documents.title: 'pivotal ' week for stocks
text: david cheetham , chief market analyst at xtb said inflation data published this week on both sides of the atlantic will prove pivotal for stocks
the coming week could prove pivotal for stocks , with any further downside threatening to see another wave of panic grip the markets .
the threat of a higher than previously thought inflationary environment going forward has seen bond yields rise and led to some sharp selling in stocks in what appears to be a knee-jerk reaction .
the question now is whether the rapid moves were an overreaction or the start of a more sustained decline for equities .

documents.title: ofgem switching trial
text: personal finance reporter brian milligan tweets :
50,000 households who 've been on standard tariffs for 3 years to benefit from a collective switching trial , says ofgem
@ twitterid there should be one bloody price and that 's it .

documents.title: silver screens for saudi arabia
text: cinema chain vue international is moving into the middle east just months after saudi arabia lifted its 35-year ban on commercial cinemas .
the company has joined forces with abdulmohsin al hokair holding group , which runs a raft of leisure and hospitality centres , to open 30 multiplexes across the country over the next three years .
saudi arabia said late last year it would allow cinemas to open in the kingdom from this year , having been shut down during a wave of ultra-conservatism in the 1980s .

documents.title: ftse remains healthy
text: the ftse 100 remains in positive territory on the day , up 1.24 % or 87.88 points to 7,180.21 .
the biggest winners are miner evraz , up 4.65 % , and nmc health , up 4.37 % .

documents.title: 'firewall ' remedy
text: bloomberg reporter thomas seal tweets on the sky news independence promise :

new : fox and sky both say cma 's provisional findings are based on errors , but fox says an editorially `` firewalled '' sky news would be the most appropriate remedy if one is required by government
marc jacobs by marc jacobs

documents.title: breakingfox promises sky news independence
text: twenty-first century fox said it would commit to keep sky news running for at least five years and establish an independent board for the channel in a bid to to get its takeover of sky over the line .

the competition and markets authority said last month that fox 's $ 15.7bn deal to buy the 61 % of sky it does not already own should be blocked unless a way is found to prevent murdoch influencing sky 's news output .
the fox proposals were released by the cma today .
the regulator is due to present media secretary matt hancock with a final report by 1 may and he will make a final decision by 14 june .

documents.title: monzo eyes us move
text: monzo , the app-based bank , is thinking about expanding into the us .
chief executive tom blomfield tells cnbc the company is in the `` very very early stages '' of exploring the market .
`` the us is a really attractive market for us because there have n't really been any new banks the last 10 years or so , '' he says .
`` i think there is a big opportunity to use modern technology to launch a real consumer-facing bank that does the kinds of things consumers expect from a smartphone . ''
the us is a bit backward when it comes to banking - it has always been ( and remains ) the world 's biggest user of cheques

documents.title: lloyds sets diversity targets
text: lloyds banking group plans to increase the representation of ethnic minorities in its senior management to 8 % , becoming the first ftse 100 company to set a public target for this .
today 5.6 % of the bank 's senior management and 8.3 % of its entire workforce are from black and minority ethnic ( bame ) backgrounds .
that did not reflect its customer base , of which 10 % are from a bame background , lloyds said .

`` our data shows that while we are making good progress , we think this rate of progress is too slow , so we are committing to bring change sooner , '' said fiona cannon , director of responsible business and inclusion at lloyds .

documents.title: carillion : 4,418 more workers saved , but 59 jobs go
text: the official receiver says it has saved the jobs of a further 4,418 former carillion workers by transferring `` prison facilities management and defence bases catering and cleaning contracts to new providers '' .
however , it adds : employment could not be secured for a further 59 employees working on paused construction projects and regrettably they will leave the business later this week . ''
some 6,668 jobs have now been saved and 989 jobs lost following the collapse .

documents.title: nmc health leads ftse risers
text: gulf private hospitals operator nmc health is leading the ftse charge this morning , rising 4.9 % to £ 32.62 .
the company entered the ftse 100 index in september and last month bought controlling stakes in two smaller rivals in the middle east .

documents.title: pound shows slight recovery
text: the pound has edged up against the dollar today , rising 0.14 % to $ 1.3846 .
last week sterling suffered its biggest falls against the dollar since october .

it was hit by the broad strength in the us currency after the sharp stock market sell-off and then by worries that britain could leave the european union in a disorderly manner , triggered by eu brexit negotiator michel barnier 's warning that a transition period is `` not a given '' .

documents.title: game on
text: shares in game digital have jumped more than 10 % following the esports and financing deal with sports direct ( although it 's still only worth a meagre £ 70m ) .
analysts at liberum - which we note is the house broker for game - describe the move as an important step for the retailer as it will speed up the rollout of belong gaming arenas .

`` the potential to locate both belongs and game retail stores in sports direct stores also improves game 's ability to optimise its uk store base , where 221 lease events are due to occur in 2018 , '' they write .
not quite sure what esports is ?
our colleagues at newsbeat reveal all .

documents.title: behind the sfo 's move
text: it was always odd the sfo charged the parent company barclays plc and not barclays bank , as it was the bank that lent $ 3bn to qatar which it is alleged was used to buy shares in barclays .

at the time it was interpreted by some as sparing a strategically important bank for the uk from the harm of potentially losing the ability to operate in important markets ( the us ) - a possible consequence if convicted .
that is why today 's decision to charge the bank itself is significant .
the fact the shares are unmoved suggest markets agree with barclays insiders , who say the following .

being charged in itself is n't a problem , this incident was 10 years and four management teams ago ; it was done in order to save the bank ( and the taxpayer billions ) and even if convicted there are banks ( ubs , bnp , credit suisse ) that have been convicted and continued operating .
read the full story here .
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: east coast issues
text: mps will examine the imminent collapse of the east coast rail franchise , for which a stagecoach-virgin consortium paid more than £ 3bn .
they now they say they are running out of money and that passenger numbers have been much lower than predicted .
tony miles from modern railways magazine tells bbc breakfast why predicting passenger numbers is difficult on the long-distance line .
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: asian markets steady
text: it 's been relatively calm on asian markets on monday after the recent dramatic sell-offs .
hong kong 's hang seng index - which slumped 9 % last week - did end lower on monday , but by just 0.2 % at 29,459.6 points .
but over on the mainland , the shanghai composite index rose 0.8 % to 3,154.1 .
japan 's nikkei - the other key market in the region - was closed for a public holiday .

documents.title: best in show
text: adam sherwin , arts and media correspondent at the i newspaper , has some exciting crufts news :
crufts 2018 to be shown as olym tv sporting event in channel 4 upgrade @ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: unilever threatens to pull online ads
text: marmite , persil and pg tips maker unilever has threatened to pull its advertising from online platforms that it says do not protect children or create division in society .

the world 's second-largest advertiser - after rival consumer goods firm proctor & gamble- has sent out a direct challenge to the likes of facebook and google to prove that they are `` committed to making a positive impact '' .
keith weed , unilever 's chief marketing officer , says the company `` needs its consumers to have trust in our brands .
we ca n't do anything to damage that trust - including the choice of channels and platforms we use .
2018 is the year when social media must win trust back . ''
last year unilever spent £ 6.8bn on advertising .

documents.title: wood climbs after aramco deal
text: shares in john wood group have climbed 2.5 % after winning a `` multimillion-dollar '' contract with oil giant saudi aramco .
the energy and engineering services firm says the five-year contract will see it help the middle eastern firm deliver `` one of its mega projects '' in saudi arabia .

wood group , which completed its acquisition of amec foster wheeler last year , said it will start providing engineering and project management services to develop the marjan oil field in the country 's eastern province as part of the contract .

documents.title: europe opens higher
text: like london , european markets have climbed across the board this morning .
frankfurt 's dax has climbed 1.6 % , the cac in paris is 1.2 % higher , and there have been similar rises in amsterdam , brussels and madrid .

rebecca o'keeffe , head of investment at interactive investor , comments : `` investors are breathing a sigh of relief after the torrid times last week , with european equity markets rallying this morning . ''

documents.title: shared parental leave problems
text: only 2 % of new parents have opted to take up shared parental leave since it was introduced in 2015 .
it means up to 50 weeks of leave can be shared by parents , 37 weeks of which is paid .
kate cooper from the institute of leadership and management tells bbc breakfast that financial pressures are to blame for the low take-up - but a lack of role models is also a problem .
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: go gaming at sports direct
text: game digital plans to open gaming areas and concessions in some sports direct stores .
the sportswear chain retailer controlled by mike ashley - who bought a 26 % stake in game last year - has taken a half-share in game 's belong gaming arenas for £ 3.2m .
sports direct will also provide loan facilities of up to £ 55m to fund new venues for the arenas .
game has opened 19 belong arenas to date .

documents.title: debt distress
text: the resolution foundation has been examining the consequences of uk households ' massive debt mountain :
there 's a lot of debt out there and rates are set to rise .
but it 's the distribution of debt that really matters .
good news : recent growth driven by higher income households .
bad news : the old problems for lower income families are still there
the key balance for the bank of england we owe more relative to our income than in most of the past 30 years , but we 're spending less on servicing it .
even modest rate rises will quickly alter this
and before we even get into rate rises , we 've already got 1.2 million households ( 6 % of all working-age households ) suffering at least three measures of debt 'distress '
not to worry , the stock market 's hitting all time highs and that 's all that matters , the real economy does n't .
all wealth comes from the sm , not land and labour , right ?

documents.title: breakingftse opens higher
text: the ftse 100 has opened 0.9 % higher at 7,157 points , almost erasing friday 's 1.1 % decline .
despite the announcement today of more sfo charges , shares in barclays are 1 % higher .

documents.title: barclays ' banking licence under threat
text: more on the barclays story : the serious fraud office has charged barclays bank plc with `` unlawful financial assistance '' related to billions of pounds raised from qatari investors in 2008 .
the same charges were bought against barclays plc in june last year .
the move to charge barclays bank as well is significant because it holds the banking licence that allows it to operate in different countries .
if barclays was found guilty , it could lose that crucial licence .
barclays took the £ 12bn loan at the height of the financial crisis in 2008 from qatar holdings to avoid a government bailout .

documents.title: shopper figures fall
text: more bad news for retailers : shopper footfall fell by 1.6 % year-on-year , the british retail consortium reports .
shopping centre footfall slumped 3.1 % , while high street figures were down 1.9 % .
meanwhile footfall in retail parks rose 0.9 % .
all regions showed a drop in footfall for january , with the sharpest declines in scotland ( 4.6 % ) , the south west ( 2.6 % ) and the east ( 2.5 % ) .
helen dickinson , brc chief executive , says : january painted a of divided fortunes with a slight improvement in town vacancy rates but decline in shopper footfall . ''

documents.title: 'a correction , not a crash '
text: what has prompted the recent market volatility ?

ritu vohora , equities investment director at m & g investment tells today volatility has been at historically low levels in the past couple of years , so concerns about rising inflation and rising interest rates have unsettled investors .
`` you have a lot of products that bet volatility will stay low for longer .
so when volatility up they had to sell those positions and unwind those risky assets - and that 's a lot of the sell-off we saw last week , '' she says .

`` but when you look at the fundamentals of the economy , the economic data is still very robust , corporate earnings are at the best they have been , and as we move through a process of normalisation it 's likely to be a bumpy ride .
but i think it 's a correction rather than a full-scale crash . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: breakingsfo charges barclays bank
text: the serious fraud office has charged barclays bank over a loan to the state of qatar in 2008 .
the charge is related to issues that arose from barclay 's capital-raising that year .

the sfo last year charged the parent company with one offence of `` unlawful financial assistance '' in regard to a $ 3bn ( £ 2.2bn ) loan provided to the state of qatar in november 2008 , but had not at the time decided whether to charge the barclays bank unit as well .
barclays bank has now been charged with the same offence .
barclays and barclays bank said they intended to defend themselves against the charges .
`` barclays does not expect there to be an impact on its ability to serve its customers and clients as a consequence of the charge having been brought , '' the company said .

documents.title: heathrow flying high
text: heathrow has had its busiest january , with 5.8 million passengers - up 1.1 % on the same month last year .
the growth was driven by a 6.9 % rise in domestic flights , as flybe 's popularity jumped .

commenting on the start of the public consultation into heathrow 's third runway , chief executive john holland-kaye says : `` heathrow expansion will provide the global trading routes to super-charge britain 's economy as we leave the eu . ''

documents.title: froth ahead for heineken
text: it 's not just the stock market that is set for more ups and downs : the chief executive of heineken - the world 's second-largest brewer - expects more `` volatility and uncertainty '' ahead .
the dutch brewer , whose heineken lager is europe 's top-selling beer , says that will cut growth in operating margin this year .
operating profit rose 6.2 % to €3.76bn ( £ 3.33bn ) last year , in line with expectations .
heineken bought 1,900 pubs from punch taverns in the uk last year , by the way .

documents.title: singapore 's tourism boom
text: while we 're on the subject of travel , singapore 's formula 1 race , glitzy malls and street food has sparked a tourism boom .
the number of visitors to the city-state rose 6.2 % to a record 17.4 million last year , official figures just out indicate .
china remains its biggest market for tourists , while visitor numbers from india were also on the rise .
the industry makes up about 4 % of singapore 's economy - and provisional estimates suggest those visitors brought in about $ 20bn last year .
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: not cleared for takeoff
text: anyone planning to fly in or out of london city airport today wo n't be going anywhere : all flights have been cancelled following the discovery of a second world war bomb in king george v dock on sunday .
robert sinclair , the airport 's chief executive , says today :
i recognise this is causing inconvenience for our passengers , and in particular some of our local residents .
the airport is cooperating fully with the met police and royal navy and working hard to safely remove the device and resolve the situation as quickly as possible . ''

documents.title: probe opens into australian banks
text: it may surprise some readers to learn that finance is australia 's biggest industry , with its banks some of world 's most profitable .
but after years of complaints about high fees and bad financial advice , coupled with allegations of misconduct , the banking sector is now under formal investigation .
a 12-month royal commission inquiry the banking industry has started looking into allegations of misconduct across the sector .
led by a former high court judge , the inquiry has the power to examine documents and compel witnesses to appear .
the head of the royal commission has warned banks not to try to prevent whistle-blowers from giving evidence .
author: Hywel Griffith
BBC News, Sydney

documents.title: uncertainty ahead
text: what lies ahead for stock markets after £ 3trn was wiped off the value of shares last week ?
megan greene , chief economist at manulife asset management , tells today the catalyst for last week 's turbulence was the us jobs data that indicated good wages growth .
but if you looked under the hood and kick the tyres of that wage growth figure it was n't actually that strong .
the number of hours worked dropped and wage growth was n't broadly based , so it mainly went to the bosses , not the worker bees , which suggest it may not be continued , '' she says .
uncertainty about what may be coming also rose , ms greene adds .

`` that 's because the head of every major bank will turn over in the next two years , so the architects of the easy money policy wo n't be in charge anymore - and it 's not clear that their successors will have the same opinions . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: tesco takes on aldi ?
text: you may have seen the sunday times story yesterday that tesco is planning a chain of cut-price stores in a bid to counter the growth of discount rivals aldi and lidl .
britain 's biggest supermarket chain is said to be developing a separate brand that would match its german competitors on price but offer a more limited range than its main stores .
tesco did not comment on the story .
data from research group kantar worldpanel last week showed sales at tesco rose by 2.6 % in the past 12 weeks , but all the big four supermarkets lost market share to both aldi and lidl .

documents.title: more market turbulence this week ?
text: all eyes have been on asian markets to try and get a sense of whether this week is going to be as turbulent as last week was for global stocks .
but with most major indexes in the region rising today , the sense is that wall street 's recovery on friday has instilled a bit of confidence .
markets in china and south korea added about 0.8 % in morning trading , while tokyo is closed for a public holiday .
earlier , imf chief christine lagarde described last week 's sell-off as `` necessary corrections '' .
`` the market trepidation that we have seen in the last few days are not worrying me , '' she told an economic forum in dubai .
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: good morning !
text: welcome to monday and another week on business live .
it 's half-term for schools in england , so the diary is looking a little more sparse than normal , but as always we will bring you all the news from the uk and beyond as it happens .
do get in touch with your thoughts as well : bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk
